definition: to disperse/to scatter in all directions
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: As the police moved in, the hostages were running out, he said.
sentences.chinese: 隨着警方進入該區域，人質也都四散跑出。

sentences.english: They must have thought they were going to get in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 她們立馬四散而逃，她們肯定以爲自己闖了什麼大禍。

sentences.english: They scattered, leaving behind bloodstains and missing shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他們四散奔逃，只留下血跡和掉下的鞋子。

sentences.english: And I will scatter them as stubble, which is carried away by the wind in the desert.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，我必使他們四散，像被曠野裏的風捲去的草芥。

sentences.english: The crowd quicky melted away when the storm broke.
sentences.chinese: 暴風雨襲來，人羣很快地四散了。

sentences.english: The ducks scattered, leaving two snapping turtles in his path.
sentences.chinese: 鴨子們都四散開去，恰好有兩隻大烏龜擋在那裏。

sentences.english: The mist was scattered over the mountain by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 雲氣漫山，隨風四散，恍如隔世。

sentences.english: Geese scatter, shopkeepers stand in their doorways.
sentences.chinese: 鵝羣四散開來，店主們在門前站着。

sentences.english: The clouds cleared away, and a fresh breeze sprang up.
sentences.chinese: 烏雲四散，清新的微風吹拂着。

sentences.english: The butterflies are flapping wildly. A security guard swoops in.
sentences.chinese: 蝴蝶撲扇着翅膀四散開來，一個保安衝了進來。

sentences.english: A group of zebras started up by a shot.
sentences.chinese: 一聲槍響把一羣斑馬驚得四散奔逃。

sentences.english: Terrified animals flee before the onslaught.
sentences.chinese: 森林中的動物驚恐的四散奔逃。

sentences.english: The rioters dispersed only after military tanks rumbled through the street.
sentences.chinese: 只有當坦克駛入街道後暴民才四散奔逃。

sentences.english: The audience fled in panic when the bull got loose.
sentences.chinese: 那隻公牛掙開了束縛，嚇得觀衆急忙四散逃走。

sentences.english: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.
sentences.chinese: 我必將埃及人分散在列國，四散在列邦。

sentences.english: Chickens are scattering its dust abroad with their beaks.
sentences.chinese: 一羣母雞正把地上的灰塵啄得四散。

definition: see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
to run away/to flee in disarray
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
